executive_summary: Economic performance and construction activity are two major factors influencing growth for interior designers. Residential and commercial markets are interior designers' vital downstream markets. While both markets adjust spending on interior design based on changes in economic activity, the mix of residential and commercial designers balances the effect on the industry. For instance, positive trends in consumer spending and the housing market over the past five years have offset shakier activity in the nonresidential sphere. Rising consumer spending in recent years has benefited independent designers, the bulk of the profession, as homeowners spent more on interior design. In all, industry-wide revenue has been expanding at a CAGR of 2.9% to an estimated $25.9 billion over the past five years, including an anticipated 2.9% boost in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Overall Economic Growth Translates Into Consistent Revenue Growth
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Economic growth in recent years has supported higher consumption of interior design services from commercial and residential markets.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Residential Markets Offer Mixed Results for Interior Designers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Favorable economic conditions contributed to growth in the residential construction sector, interior designers' most significant source of revenue, which supported revenue growth. Nonresidential construction activity has been shakier in recent years despite economic growth.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Residential Markets Offer Mixed Results for Interior Designers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Designers specializing in residential markets benefited from a jump in housing starts and the homeownership rate. Underlying this growth was a shortage in the housing stock, particularly in densely populated areas such as New York.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: A SLOWDOWN IN CONSTRUCTION ACTIVITY WILL CURTAIL LARGER GROWTH
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As the Federal Reserve continues to battle heightened inflation, high interest rates will slow down residential and commercial construction activity.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: HIGH INTEREST RATES CONTINUE TO EXACERBATE UNCERTAINTY OVER INTERIOR DESIGN DEMAND
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A rising focus on employee well-being will continue to push companies to invest in redesigns emphasizing health and wellness.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Designers Will Continue to Prioritize Design Trends to Differentiate Client Demand
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Opportunities for innovation are limited in interior design.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Growing Use of Technology Will Accelerate Interior Designers' Efficiency
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Interior designers will continue to embrace the latest developments in technology.

key_trends: Independent designers create price competition in local markets.
Consumers can easily compare prices and portfolios, driving competition among local interior designers and benefiting customers with more choices and competitive pricing.

FAQs.question: What is the International Interior Design Association (IIDA)?
FAQs.answer: The IIDA provides vital resources to commercial interior designers and their clients.

FAQs.question: What is the American Society of Interior Designers (ASID)?
FAQs.answer: ASID offers extensive professional support to interior designers.

FAQs.question: What is the National Council for Interior Design Qualification (NCIDQ)?
FAQs.answer: NCIDQ offers a certification that's essential for interior designers aspiring to professional credibility.

FAQs.question: What is a common strategy for interior design companies?
FAQs.answer: It is common for industry operators to provide a wide range of design services.

FAQs.question: How have economic changes influenced consumer demand?
FAQs.answer: This industry is reliant on downstream construction industries.

FAQs.question: What is a significant operational expense for interior design companies?
FAQs.answer: For most companies this is purchases, with wages second.

FAQs.question: How do companies advertise their services?
FAQs.answer: The way industry operators promote their services may change depending on the client.

FAQs.question: Has investment in new technologies increased competitiveness?
FAQs.answer: Many firms have invested in CAD and BIM software.

FAQs.question: Has new technology disrupted service offerings?
FAQs.answer: New apps and online platforms pose an increasing form of external competition.

FAQs.question: Has the regulatory environment changed significantly?
FAQs.answer: Regulations have not changed much, and are not expected to do so.
